mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Sarah Tracy to Ann Pamela Cunningham, 1861 April 1
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Tracy, Sarah, 1820-1896
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Letter, Sarah Tracy, secretary, to Ann Pamela Cunningham, April 1, 1861. Includes typed transcript. Washington, D.C. Went to Mount Vernon, John A. Washington on boat. Mr. Herbert will send an official account of condition of General Washington's room. Laths are not decayed, plaster can be mended, paper is badly discolored, woodwork to be painted, windows can be altered. Stays at Mount Vernon a few days, fits sitting room carpet. Mansion is in tidy condition. Library porch can be fixed. Plants in greenhouse and vegetables in hot-beds in good condition Describes Mrs. Lincoln's visit. Patent office will send Mount Vernon seeds.
